skill.name: docstring
skill.description: Write docstrings for PyTorch functions and methods following PyTorch conventions. Use when writing or updating docstrings in PyTorch code.
skill.summary: Write docstrings for PyTorch functions and methods following PyTorch conventions. Use when writing o...
skill.author: pytorch

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for writing PyTorch docstrings. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands.

content.value_statement: PyTorch requires specific docstring formatting using Sphinx and reStructuredText conventions. This skill provides templates and guidelines for creating consistent, complete documentation following PyTorch project standards.
actual_capabilities: Generate function signature lines with proper parameter formatting
Document Args and Returns sections with type annotations
Add mathematical formulas using LaTeX notation
Create cross-references to related PyTorch classes and functions
Format Examples sections with Python code blocks
Apply warnings and notes using Sphinx admonitions
limitations: Specific to PyTorch project conventions only
Limited to functions and methods, not module-level docs

use_cases.title: Add docstrings to new functions
use_cases.description: Create properly formatted docstrings when adding new operations to PyTorch library code.

use_cases.title: Document custom modules
use_cases.description: Apply PyTorch documentation conventions to custom module implementations for consistency.

use_cases.title: Update existing documentation
use_cases.description: Maintain consistency when updating or fixing docstrings in the PyTorch codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Basic function docstring
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a docstring for this PyTorch function using the docstring skill conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Function with math
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a docstring for this function that includes mathematical formulas in LaTeX format.

prompt_templates.title: Tensor method
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an in-place method docstring that references the original Tensor method using cross-references.

prompt_templates.title: Complete documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete PyTorch docstring including Args, Returns, Examples, and Notes sections.

output_examples.input: Write a docstring for a function that performs softmax normalization along a specified dimension.
output: ‚Ä¢ Function signature with parameters and return type
‚Ä¢ Mathematical formula using Sphinx math directive
‚Ä¢ Args section documenting input tensor and dimension parameter
‚Ä¢ Examples section with Python code showing usage

best_practices: Always use raw strings (r""") to avoid issues with backslashes in LaTeX formulas
Include the function signature on the first line showing all parameters with defaults
Add Examples section with runnable Python code demonstrating typical usage
Use Sphinx cross-references (`:class:`, `:func:`) to link related PyTorch components
anti_patterns: Using regular strings instead of raw strings causes issues with LaTeX backslashes
Omitting the Examples section reduces usability for downstream developers
Missing type annotations in Args section makes API harder to understand

faq.question: Does this skill work for non-PyTorch projects?
faq.answer: No. The conventions are specific to PyTorch. General Python docstrings should use different conventions like Google style or NumPy style.

faq.question: What is the maximum line length for docstrings?
faq.answer: PyTorch convention recommends keeping lines under 100 characters when possible for readability.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for C-bound functions?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes guidance on using _add_docstr for C-bound functions and add_docstr_all for in-place variants.

faq.question: Does this skill access any files on my system?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that only provides documentation guidance. It does not read or write files.

faq.question: How do I reference external papers in docstrings?
faq.answer: Use the .. _Link Name: https://arxiv.org/abs/ pattern and reference with `Link Name`_ in the text.

faq.question: How is this different from auto-docstring tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides PyTorch-specific conventions and templates rather than auto-generating docstrings from function signatures.
